bestBHT.bht: The eternal Covenant reveals a great law of our Father's spiritual Kingdom. While not universally true among men, it unveils the significance of praying with the right intentions, object, and manner. Those who ask amiss may not receive. However, those who diligently utilize means alongside prayer, such as attending other ordinances, will find their petitions fulfilled. This highlights the importance of aligning our prayers with God's will and actively pursuing our desires through prayer and faithful actions.

Henry Alford: Declares to us [...] a great law of our Father's spiritual Kingdom.
A clause out of the eternal Covenant, which cannot be changed.
Not merely a result observable here among men, (in which sense it is not universally true).
John Gill: Some indeed ask and receive not, because they ask amiss."
When a man is right in the object of prayer, and in the matter and manner of prayer, and in the end he proposes to himself, let him be what he will, he has the petitions which he asks.
Whoever not only prays, but makes use of means, as attendance on other ordinances, and is diligent in the use of them, sooner or later finds his account herein.

bhtAttempts.bht: This verse declares a great law of our Father's spiritual Kingdom, rooted in an eternal Covenant that cannot be changed. It emphasizes that the result of this law, though not universally true among men, is not merely observable in the earthly realm. The verse explains that some people do not receive because they ask amiss, highlighting the importance of being right in the object, matter, and manner of prayer. However, those who are diligent in prayer and also utilize other means, such as attending other ordinances, will ultimately find their requests fulfilled. This verse encourages believers to align their prayers with God's will and to actively engage in their pursuit of answered prayers.

The eternal Covenant reveals a great law of our Father's spiritual Kingdom. While not universally true among men, it unveils the significance of praying with the right intentions, object, and manner. Those who ask amiss may not receive. However, those who diligently utilize means alongside prayer, such as attending other ordinances, will find their petitions fulfilled. This highlights the importance of aligning our prayers with God's will and actively pursuing our desires through prayer and faithful actions.

This verse unveils a significant law from our Father's eternal Covenant that cannot be changed. It emphasizes the importance of praying with the right intentions, object, and manner, as some people who ask amiss may not receive. The verse encourages believers to diligently use means alongside prayer, such as attending other ordinances, to find their requests ultimately fulfilled. By aligning our prayers with God's will and actively pursuing them with faithful actions, we can experience the power of answered prayer in our lives.

This statement reveals an unchanging law within the spiritual Kingdom of our Father, rooted in an eternal Covenant. It emphasizes the need to approach prayer with the right intentions and manner, recognizing that not everyone will experience universal fulfillment. However, the passage highlights that those who combine prayer with diligent means, such as attending other ordinances, will ultimately witness their requests being granted. It underscores the importance of aligning our prayers with God's will and actively engaging in the pursuit of our desires.

This declaration reveals an unchanging law of our Father's spiritual Kingdom, stemming from an eternal Covenant. It reminds us that not everyone will experience universal fulfillment when it comes to prayer. The key lies in praying with the right intentions and manner, while incorporating diligent means, such as attending other ordinances. By aligning our prayers with God's will and actively pursuing our desires, we can witness the fulfillment of our requests.
